communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Public Records Request - Marion County 2
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to formally request access to video footage from a police intervention, specifically from the body camera worn by the officer(s) and the dashcam of the police vehicles involved. Article:
https://www.villages-news.com/2024/04/15/walmart-shoplifting-suspect-apprehended-in-golf-cart-at-stonecrest-pool/#google_vignette

Exact date of incident: April 14, 2024
Names of parties involved: Natalie Nicole Martin

I intend to use this footage solely for educational purposes to promote a better understanding of law enforcement procedures and the application of the law.

I understand that there may be associated costs for providing this footage, and I am more than willing to cover any fees incurred. Please inform me about the necessary procedures and the costs involved.

Thank you in advance for your assistance. I trust that this footage will be invaluable for my educational efforts, and I greatly appreciate your cooperation.


Best regards,
George Smith

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

George Smith

title: Police Foundations PR (Chula Vista Police Department)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Hello, 

I am seeking records as they relate to the department and donations, grants, or other gifts from police nonprofits, including Foundations, Benevolent Funds, Boosters, Activities Leagues, and Associations. Include local and national police nonprofits.

Documents, physical or digital copies of: 
Memorandum of Understanding or any formal agreements with nonprofits.
Polices related to accepting and soliciting donations, monetary and nonmonetary, and grants from any nonprofit.
Policies or requirements by the department on how donations are to be tracked.
Policies regarding any conflict of interest requirements.
Formal grant requests or donation requests filled out by the department or a representative for the department.

Databases that include spreadsheets or whatever form the department tracks such information: 
Donor name
What was donated, monetary and non-monetary value
Date
Release data in .csv form 

For grant and donation data, please only include items and cash valued $500 or more.
Limit searches to 2020 to 2025

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott

title: Call Center Contracts & Job Classifications – RDI Corp & Vermont AHS/DCF (2021–2025) (Department of Health & Human Services)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Vermont Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting public records related to contractual agreements and employment classification details involving RDI Corporation and the State of Vermont from January 1, 2021 to present. Specifically:

	1.	All contracts, MOUs, amendments, or extensions between the State (or its agencies, including AHS and DCF) and RDI Corporation for call center, hotel placement, or program eligibility services;
	2.	Job descriptions, pay ranges, and classification information for State of Vermont employees performing similar duties to those performed by RDI contractors;
	3.	Policy memos, emails, or communications detailing RDI’s responsibilities and performance expectations under the above contracts.

Please provide responsive documents in digital format. If any records are withheld, I request a written explanation citing the legal exemption(s) used.

I respectfully request that any fees be waived, as this request is made in the public interest for purposes of transparency and accountability regarding state-contracted service providers. I am not seeking these records for commercial use or private profit.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request be fulfilled electronically (email attachment preferred; CD-ROM if unavailable).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Mignon Wilson

title: Trooper Activity and Incident Records Related to Mayor Wu's Appearance on July 29, 2025

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Trooper Activity and Incident Records Related to Mayor Wu's Appearance on July 29, 2025
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Dear Records Access Officer,

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, G.L. c. 66, § 10, I respectfully request copies of all records created, received, or maintained by the Massachusetts State Police relating to trooper activity, assignments, or incidents in connection with Mayor Michelle Wu’s public appearance near Boston Medical Center on July 29, 2025. This would include those created before that day to coordinate, assign, or plan for the visit or created after that day that summarize, report, or respond to the trooper's presence, duties, or actions that took place. 

This request includes—but is not limited to—records involving:

Any Massachusetts State Police officers or troopers assigned to interact with, escort, protect, or clear areas for Mayor Wu during her visit on July 29, 2025, including in the vicinity of:
East Springfield Street
Boston Medical Center
Blunch Café
Harrison Avenue
Mass Ave Connector

Any State Police activity involving assistance to individuals on East Springfield Street, including—but not limited to—a reported instance of a trooper helping a individual off the ground shortly before Mayor Wu emerged from the BMC entrance at approximately 12:15 PM.

Records documenting assignments, movement, or coordination by State Police in connection with this visit, including:

Daily activity or shift logs for involved officers
Incident reports or field contact reports
Dispatch logs or CAD entries
Escort assignments or dignitary protection orders
Any internal email, inter-agency communication, or planning documents involving coordination with Boston Police, BMC security, ,City Hall, BPHC or another agency.
Any body-worn or vehicle camera footage.
Any photos, surveillance stills, or video logs showing the State Police present during the visit


Format & Delivery
I prefer to receive these records electronically via email in PDF, CSV, or native digital format where possible. 

If no responsive records exist for a given item, please confirm that in writing.
Please identify the systems and custodians searched, and describe how records were located.
If records exist in draft, revised, or non-final form, please include those as well.
If responsive records include logs, summaries, or databases, please provide machine-readable copies (e.g., .csv or Excel).

Thank you for your attention to this request.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brian McCarter

title: Data & Communications Provided to Boston Globe for Vennochi Article (July 30, 2025)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Dear Records Access Officer,

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, G.L. c. 66, § 10, this is a request for records that were supplied by City of Boston officials to the Boston Globe and cited in the following article:

“According to data supplied by city officials, so far this year in the Mass. and Cass area, there were 51 petitions for involuntary commitment under Section 35. According to this data, arrests are up, as well as what are called ‘interactions’ with people on the streets for situations involving drugs, fights, intoxication, panhandling, and vandalism.”
— Joan Vennochi, “Involuntary commitment should be on the table in the opioid crisis,” Boston Globe, July 30, 2025.
Link: https://www.bostonglobe.com/2025/07/30/opinion/section-35-involuntary-commitment-drugs-alcohol-boston-mayor-race/?p1=StaffPage

As these records were created and affirmatively disclosed to the press, any deliberative process or other exemptions under G.L. c. 4, § 7(26) have been waived. Furthermore, as the responsive records have already been located, compiled, and distributed, they are not subject to search or retrieval fees pursuant to 950 CMR 32.07(2)(m).

Accordingly, please produce the following:

1.
The exact records provided to the Boston Globe or its reporter, Joan Vennochi, that contain, comprise, or were used to generate the figures and assertions in the quoted text. This includes, but is not limited to, any spreadsheet, report, data export, chart, internal briefing, or summary document showing:

The basis for the "51 petitions for involuntary commitment under Section 35" in the Mass and Cass area for the specified time period.

The data supporting the claim that "arrests are up."

The data supporting the claim that “‘interactions’... are up."

2.

All communications memorializing the transmission of these records to the Boston Globe or Joan Vennochi. This includes, but is not limited to, emails and attachments, text messages, and messages on platforms such as Slack or Microsoft Teams.

The names, titles, and departments of all city personnel who compiled, reviewed, approved, or transmitted the above-referenced information to the press. This request is for records of official government actions and is not a request for personnel files.

3
Identification of the source systems or databases used to generate the figures provided (e.g., Salesforce, Power BI, CAD logs, Mark43, internal BPHC trackers).


Please provide all responsive records in their original electronic format (e.g., .xlsx, .csv, .pdf, .msg, or .eml). Records should be produced with only the redactions that existed at the time of their original transmission to the Boston Globe. No new redactions may be applied, as any applicable exemption was waived upon prior disclosure.

This request is addressed to the Mayor’s Office as the apparent coordinating entity, with other relevant city departments copied. If any part of this request is better directed to another custodian, please specify.

If you contend that no responsive records exist, please provide a written statement detailing the custodians and locations searched, the date of the search, and the specific search terms used to make that determination.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brian McCarter

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: VBA/PACT ACT/Determination for, Quancidine Hinson-Gribble
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I, Quancidine Hinson-Gribble (SURVIVING SPOUSE) of, Robert Gribble, Deceased Date: 11/18/2011, had filed my initial claim for “SURVIVORS” Benefits in, February, 2012. My late husband, Robert Gribble; suffered from: “COLON CANCER”, while he was active duty at the age of “30”. Other health issues included: “HARD OF HEARING” (Robert Gribble filed a claim for this health issue), and received a determination, however the determination did not generate any payments. Other health issues surfaced however ; at that time some of the diseases were “NOT” classified for approval for payment. So, I was told. In, 2022, I filed a claim through the “PACT ACT” Portal. I never received anything in writing, any emails or anything. I knew that with the new “CLASSIFICATIONS”, For War Service that my claim for my late husband,  Robert Gribble (last four 5802) met the criteria, for serving in the Vietnam War and the Korean War. The dates on my “AWARD LETTER” includes the dates of when my late husband, Robert Gribble served in the, United States Army. The last four numbers of my claim number is: 5802. On my “AWARD LETTER” as the “SURVIVING SPOUSE” of, Robert Gribble, read the following “VA Benefit Information: Was the Veteran considered to be totally and permanently disabled at the time of death: NO”. I am requesting all records of applications made for benefits. I am requesting all records for payments made. I am requesting all applications filed through the “PACT ACT” PORTAL and awards made. I am requesting all documents, records and payments made, banking information, to include checking and or savings information to include, routing number, savings and or checking information. I am requesting the same for any applications and payments made by the, Veterans Benefits Administration for myself, Quancidine Hinson-Gribble and my late husband, Robert Gribble.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Quancidine Hinson-Gribble

communications.subject: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: MiSUD Locator
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Dear FOIA Officer,

I am writing to request records under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) related to the development and implementation of the Substance Use Disorder treatment locator tool by the Michigan Department of Health and Human Services (MDHHS) known as MiSUD (website: https://www.michigan.gov/opioids/find-help/misud-locator). Specifically, I am seeking information to understand the resources, decision-making processes, and considerations that went into developing the MiSUD tool. My request includes, but is not limited to, the following documents and information:

1. Development Costs:
   - Detailed breakdowns of all costs associated with the development, implementation, and maintenance of the MiSUD treatment locator tool.
   - Contracts, invoices, and payment records related to third-party vendors or consultants involved in the project.

2. Decision-Making Processes:
   - Meeting minutes, memos, emails, and other communications discussing the selection of Microsoft Business Intelligence (BI) as the platform for the MiSUD treatment locator tool.
   - Documentation outlining the evaluation criteria and process for selecting the technology stack, including any comparative analyses of alternative tools or platforms to host MiSUD.
   - Needs assessment documentation outlining the evaluation criteria of existing treatment locators, including any comparative analyses and gaps that MiSUD is intended to fill.

3. Project Documentation:
   - Project plans, timelines, and scope documents related to the development of the MiSUD treatment locator tool.
   - Requirements documents, use cases, and user stories that informed the MiSUD development process.

4. Feedback and Evaluations:
   - Reports, evaluations, or assessments of the MiSUD treatment locator tool's performance, usability, and effectiveness, including mobile use and any assessment of the primary use cases for this tool.
   - User feedback, complaints, or suggestions related to the tool, including any documented issues or limitations and the plan to address these issues.

5. Additional Related Decisions:
   - Documentation related to any other decisions that may have contributed to the perceived inefficiencies, redundancies, or suboptimal performance of the tool.
   - Any studies, analyses, or reports that discuss the impact or outcomes of using the MiSUD treatment locator tool.

I request that all documents and information be provided in electronic format, if available. If there are any fees associated with this request, please inform me of the total cost before processing the request. I am willing to pay reasonable fees up to $25.

Please let me know if you require any additional information to process this request. I look forward to your prompt response.

Sincerely,

Jonathan JK Stoltman, PhD

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jonathan Stoltman

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: ODNI DIG's recent declassified releases
communications.communication:
Dear Office of the Director of National Intelligence,

On behalf of myself and Fiat Fiendum, I hereby request the following records under the FOIA:

1. the fully unredacted versions of the following files recently made public by the ODNI with various redactions (including redaction of footnotes and classification markings):
a. https://www.dni.gov/files/ODNI/documents/DIG/DIG-Declassified-Evidence-Obama-Subvert-President-Trump-2016-Victory-Election-July2025.pdf
b. https://www.dni.gov/files/ODNI/documents/DIG/DIG-Russia-Hoax-Memo-and-Timeline_revisited.pdf
c. https://www.dni.gov/files/ODNI/documents/DIG/DIG-Declassified-HPSCI-Report-Manufactured-Russia-Hoax-July2025.pdf
d. https://www.dni.gov/files/ODNI/documents/DIG/DIG-Declassified-Biden-Administration-Documents-Labeling-COVID-Dissenters-Others-as-Domestic-Violent-Extremists.pdf
e. https://www.dni.gov/files/ODNI/documents/DIG/DIG-Declassified-Strategic-Implementation-Plan-for-CT-April2025.pdf

2. every record which is incorporated in the above documents

3. for each record above, a CSV formatted spreadsheet of the following EO 13526 information:
a. a unique record identifier, and location information, sufficient to enable a FOIA officer to easily and precisely locate that record, and that is as descriptive as is feasible without disclosing classified information
b. the date the record was created
c. the classification level and codewords (e.g. "TS/SCI//FISA", "SECRET//ORCON/NOFORN", "TOP SECRET//COMINT//REL TO USA, FVEY",  or the like)
d. the identity of the original classification authority, including their personal identifier, agency, office, position, and name
e. the agency and office of origin
f. the date of original classification
g. the date or event for declassification per EO 13526 § 1.5(a), or the 10–25 year declassification date per § 1.5(b), as the case may be
h. the concise reason for classification
i. the applicable classifications categories from EO 13526 § 1.4
j. the  associated "classification guide" and/or "declassification guide" within the meaning of EO 13526 § 6.1(h) & (n), or if those are separate full documents rather than relatively short text, their record unique identifiers
k. EO 13526 § 1.6(a)(1)(D) information (in the case of information that should clearly and demonstrably be expected to reveal the identity of a confidential human source or a human intelligence source or key design concepts of weapons of mass destruction, the marking prescribed in implementing directives issued pursuant to EO 13526)
l. EO 13526 § 3.3(b), (c), (d), (g), (h), (i), & (j) information (automatic declassification exemption), including the particular subparagraphs claimed to be applicable, and the applicable details (such as explanations of exemption, date exempted, exempting authority, etc)
m. all other classification metadata, such as "derived from" markers (see e.g. EO 13526 § 2.1), foreign classifications (see e.g. EO 13526 § 1.6(e)), etc.
n. the FOIA identifiers of every request made which covered that record
o. the same information as above as to declassification, to the extent applicable (e.g. dates, declassification authority and reasons, control authority, etc)

For all responsive records, I request:
a. all parts of the record (i.e. no portion of a record with some responsive portion may be considered "non-responsive")
b. all record metadata, such as dates on which they were drafted, passed, went into effect, withdrawn, or similar events; person(s) / office(s) responsible; authors; IDs; revision numbers; email headers; hyperlinks; structural metadata; email addresses; comments; revision history; timestamps; file names and contents; pagination or lack thereof; format specific metadata (e.g. particular to Word, PDF, or paper files); filing location, labeling, & organization; etc.
c. if any classification applies, mandatory declassification review (MDR) under E.O. 13526, and the result of the MDR, including any declassified records.


# Form & format

## Native email format & minimal redaction

Please provide all email records in EML, Maildir, or MBOX format only — not PDF, Word, image, etc — including all metadata (e.g. full email headers as received/sent) and attachments, without alteration other than narrowly tailored electronic redaction of specifically claimed exemptions that do not affect any part of non exempt information (and, in particular, without rasterization).

Please provide all other records in their original electronic format (if electronic), and as one 300dpi color scan PDF per logical document, staple, paperclip, or file folder (whichever is most narrow) if the original is in paper format.

Please note that FOIA requires you to service the maximum extent of my request that can be done via e.g. partial redaction of exempt material. If you believe some portions of a record to be exempt because it contains classified information (18 USC 798), please provide a version of the record redacted to the minimum extent necessary to remove exempt information, along with adequate information to describe the reason for each specific exemption, and without altering any non exempt information (including metadata).

## No new records; electronic & original format

This request does not ask you to create new records.

If you determine that a response would require creating a new record that you do not want to create, please first contact me by email with an explanation of what records you have that would most closely match the information requested and might be acceptable substitutes, so that we can reasonably tailor the request.

In particular, I specifically request that you do not create new documents in response to this request that are modifications of a digital record, such as page-view images, print views, scans, or the like. No such creation or substitution is authorized by FOIA.

However, if the same or similar records are held in both electronic and paper formats, this request includes both the paper and electronic versions. The paper version and the digital version are distinct records, and each may contain distinct information such as handwritten or other markings on the paper copy and embedded metadata in the electronic version. I specifically request both the original, electronic format record, and (if it contains any additional markings) the paper record.

To the extent that the original native electronic format is proprietary or otherwise not in format accessible by widely available, open source software, I also request
1. an export of the proprietary format into a standard, open format, and
2. all proprietary software and documentation necessary to use and understand the original, proprietary format records.

## Rehab Act § 508 compliance

I am partially blind. In accordance with 5 USC 552(a)(3)(B & C) (E-FOIA), Rehabilitation Act § 508, and the FOIA Improvement Act, I require that you respond using original, native format, electronic, machine-processable, accessible, open, and well structured records to the maximum extent possible — for both the content of your response, and any communications about the request (such as response letters).

Please make all correspondence pursuant to this request — including notification and responsive records — by email, with native electronic format records, as specified in the request. I do not authorize you to send anything to me by physical mail unless I specifically state otherwise.

## Compression, passwords, and uploading large files

Multiple files may be sent in a combined, compressed form using standard ZIP, TAR, GZIP, BZIP2, and/or RAR formats, or sent as separate files, at your discretion.

Do not use any password on any files, including ZIP files etc., unless a password was present in the original, native format (in which case, leave it unaltered, and send me the password). Do not respond using ZixCorp "Secure Mail" or any other method that "expires" records from being available. Use only actual email and direct attachments, or upload using the link below, unless I explicitly request otherwise.

If there are any files you prefer not to transfer by email (e.g. if they are >10MB), please upload them to me via the link listed below my signature. Doing so is secure, completely free to you, and I will be notified of the upload. If that is insufficient, I can also provide Google Drive, Dropbox, SFTP, rsync, or similar provisions that will let you easily upload hundreds of gigabytes of data to me for free.

## Redaction format 

When redacting any content, please assign a replacement identifier for each different piece of content redacted, so that your redaction does not obfuscate the commonality.

For example, suppose that responsive records include the names Alice, Bob, and Chris, and you determine that each of those names are redactable (e.g. under (b)(7) or (b)(6)). Rather than redacting each with only the text "(b)(7)(C)", replace each instance of "Alice" with "(b)(7)(D) - confidential source 1", each instance of "Bob" with "(b)(7)(C) - US congressional aide 2", each instance of "Chris" with "(b)(7)(C) - US congressional aide 3",  etc. This would vindicate your narrow interest in withholding the person's identity, while not withholding the facts of commonality between occurrences, nor the relevant natures of each redacted person, which you would not have justification to withhold.

Please use reasonably descriptive identifiers. For instance, if Alice's name is not redacted but her personal cellphone number is, and that cellphone number appears e.g. both in her email signature and elsewhere by itself, it should in both cases be redacted with the same descriptive identifier, such as "Alice's cell #" (or "confidential source 1's cell #" if her name is redacted, as above). 

Please use a unique replacement identifier number for each distinct item — e.g. even if you only redact two entities, and they have different descriptors such that the descriptors would distinguish them, use "confidential source 1" and "US congressional aide 2", not "US congressional aide 1". The result should be that there is exactly one replacement identifier number per identical redacted content, across all records produced, with no reuse of the same number for different content, nor use of different numbers for the same content — except for the purposes of descriptive reference, e.g. the "2" in "confidential source 1 email to US congressional aide 2".

If a classification codeword is itself classified — meaning very specifically the text of that codeword, e.g. if the literal texts "STLW" and/or "STELLARWIND" were themselves classified, not merely their expansions, referents, or covered records —  please use a replacement like "TSC 4" or "SC 5" (as applicable). Likewise, if the existence of a particular classification authority office is classified, please use a replacement like "NSA office 6". Etc.

For PDFs, replacement identifiers can be specified in the margins if they don't fit in the original space. For more native electronic files, like EML, this can be done by direct editing. If space or file format does not permit you to do so inline or in margins or equivalent, then please use just the replacement identifier number (e.g. "[#52]"), and provide a CSV formatted table matching replacement identifier numbers to full replacement identifiers with your response letter.

If you make any such redactions, please keep but do not provide a table matching codes/identifiers to the redacted content, for use in case your redaction is examined or overturned on appeal or in litigation.

This is a form and format request pertaining to your process of redaction. Because it only applies in situations when you have already exercised the voluntary decision to alter the records from the original form requested, you have necessarily waived any objection to this section "creating a new record", since your act of redaction itself already "makes a new record" in that limited sense. This is only about how you do a redaction you have already decided to make.

This provision limits the scope of your redaction to the minimum possible extent, and specifies the form and format of your redactions, so that even if you decide to withhold some particular piece of content, you do not also withhold the fact of its being the same as the same content appearing elsewhere, or the kind of thing redacted. That fact is itself metadata that is explicitly requested as part of this request. If you decide that the mere fact of two pieces of content being the same is itself withholdable, then please redact it using a replacement identifier that encodes only the reason.


# Rolling updates

Please provide me with rolling (incremental) updates, rather than having the entirety of the request be blocked until fully completed.

Please preserve all responsive records that you currently hold, pending release, particularly ones that are currently held in electronic form or format.

Please prioritize rolling updates based on what is most readily available, i.e. such that you release as the greatest amount of records in the fastest time.


# Fee waiver

I request fee waiver, because
* Fiat Fiendum is a 501(c)(3) non-profit;
* this request is for public interest, non-commercial, journalistic purposes;
* I am requesting records to be provided exclusively in electronic format, with no paper copies, so you should incur no actual costs; and
* the DNI has determined that widespread public release of these records is in the public interest; and
* the release of these records is itself a matter of international journalistic interest.


# Request tracking numbers and estimated completion date

Upon receipt, and in every followup response, please state your tracking number(s) for this request, as well as your specific estimated completion date. 5 USC 552(a)(7).


Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your initial response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,
Sai
President, Fiat Fiendum, Inc.
Fiat Fiendum is a 501(c)(3) tax-exempt corporation devoted to public interest journalism, government transparency and accountability, individuals' civil rights, and related issues.

P.S. My full legal name is "Sai". Please use no title for me.

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern,

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, G.L. c. 66, § 10, I am submitting the following request for records.

I respectfully request a limited set of data from the Boston Police Department’s internal database related to reported crime incidents from January 1, 2024 through December 31, 2024.

Requested Fields:

Incident_number

Offense_code

Offense_code_group

Offense_description

District

Reporting_area

Shooting (Yes/No)

Occurred_on_date

Year, Month, Hour_of_day

UCR_Part

Street (or nearest block if redaction is needed)

Latitude, Longitude, Location

Officer Identifier (Employee_ID or pseudonymous ID)

Officer Rank (at time of incident)

If any of these fields are unavailable, please let us know. If specific rows require extensive redaction under Exemptions C or F (e.g., juvenile involvement, sexual assault, witness protection), we understand and are willing to accept the dataset excluding those specific records if that significantly reduces the burden on the Department.

We are not requesting personal information on victims, witnesses, or arrestees.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,
BU SPARK!

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Monterrosso-Lemus SIR
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of all communications and records ICE provided DHS for its June 26, 2025, "Fact Check", available here: https://www.dhs.gov/news/2025/06/26/fact-check-ice-provided-full-medical-care-guatemalan-illegal-alien-history-child.

I request expedited processing of this request pursuant to 6 C.F.R. 5.5(e) and hereby declare under penalty of perjury pursuant to 28 USC 1746that the following statements in support of my expedited processing request are true and correct to the best of my knowledge and understanding:

1. I am a member of the news media primarily engaged in information dissemination through edited publications. See, e.g., https://theappeal.org/authors/andrew-free/; https://atlpresscollective.com/author/free/.
2. Ms. Monterrosso-Lemus's miscarriage in ICE custody has been the subject of widespread and exceptional media coverage raising concerns regarding the government's supervision of its contractors, which prompted DHS Press Secretary McLaughlin to issue a purported official debunking of the press coverage. https://nashvillebanner.com/2025/05/27/iris-monterroso-pregnancy-loss/; https://www.ibtimes.co.uk/woman-ice-custody-loses-baby-after-begging-help-she-was-forced-sleep-floor-eating-1736693; https://www.foxnews.com/politics/trump-dhs-contests-claim-ice-denied-pregnant-woman-care-absolutely-false.
3. Members of Congress have demanded an investigation into Ms. Monterrosso-Lemus's allegations of abuse and neglect in ICE custody: https://democraticwomenscaucus.house.gov/media/press-releases/democratic-womens-caucus-demands-investigation-ice-and-cbps-abuse-women.
4. The records requested are necessary to assess the veracity of DHS's claims in its Fact Check, several of which appear to be incorrect. For instance, the subject's husband has medical records from treatment providers as Ochsner Medical in Louisiana indicating the loss of the baby was due to inadequate PNC (pre-natal care). Similarly, the "active warrant for homicide" DHS states she had in Guatemala had been terminated years ago, which is why, after spending a week in jail upon her return, the subject was let go and is not being prosecuted.
5. Ms. McLaughlin has claimed, on the U.S. government's behalf, "“This reporting is absolutely FALSE. Iris Dayana Monterroso-Lemus had FULL medical, prenatal care,” and “We have documentation to show it.
6. The public deserves timely access to that documentation, if it exists.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Free
